oai_dc:dc.dc:title: General Field Order No. 36
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: General Field Order No. 36 from the Headquarters of the Army of the Ohio. The order allows for all units that had participated in the redemption of loyal districts to the Union to inscribe on their colors and guidons "East Tennessee". This was ordered by General Ambrose Burnside after the Union victories around Knoxville in November 1863.
